story:
Once upon a time, in a land far, far away, there was a beautiful and peaceful country called Sudan. In this country, there lived many different animals, but the most famous of them all was a young lion named Liyongo.

Liyongo was not your ordinary lion. He was known throughout the land for his courage, kindness, and wisdom. He lived in the heart of the jungle, surrounded by his animal friends, who looked up to him as their leader.

One day, Liyongo received a message from the king of the animals, the wise and old elephant, Jabari. The message said that there was trouble in the kingdom, and Liyongo was the only one who could help.

A terrible drought had hit the land, and the rivers and lakes had all dried up. The animals were struggling to find water, and many of them were getting sick. The king knew that Liyongo was the bravest and strongest of all the animals and that he would be able to find a solution to this problem.

Liyongo set off on his journey to find water. He traveled far and wide, asking all the animals he met if they had seen any sign of water. But no one had. The situation was looking dire, and Liyongo was beginning to lose hope.

Just as he was about to give up, Liyongo heard a faint murmur. He followed the sound and soon found himself at the foot of a tall mountain. And there, at the very top, he saw a small pool of water, shining in the sun.

Liyongo knew that this was the answer to the kingdom's prayers. But the pool was too high up for the other animals to reach. So, he came up with a plan.

He asked all the animals to gather at the foot of the mountain, and he told them to form a chain, linking their tails together. Liyongo climbed onto the back of the first animal, and slowly but surely, they began to climb the mountain.

It was a long and difficult journey, but the animals never gave up. They were determined to reach the water and save their kingdom. And finally, after what seemed like an eternity, they made it to the top.

The animals drank their fill, and they were overjoyed. They thanked Liyongo for his bravery and wisdom, and they hailed him as a hero.

From that day on, the animals never forgot Liyongo's bravery, and they told the story of his heroic journey to all the new generations of animals that were born. And Liyongo, the brave lion of Sudan, lived out his days in peace, knowing that he had saved his kingdom and all its inhabitants.

And now, my dear son, it's time for you to close your eyes and dream of brave and kind lions, just like Liyongo. Goodnight.
